pullRequest.title: [DOCS] Fix timeout parameter defaults
pullRequest.bodyText:
Corrects the default timeout argument for several APIs.
Closes #66077.

nodes.bodyText:
I'd like to get confirmation on this default. I had a hard time tracing/parsing it:

  
    
      elasticsearch/server/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/rest/action/admin/cluster/RestClusterStatsAction.java
    
    
         Line 50
      in
      0b536a7
    
    
    
    

        
          
           clusterStatsRequest.timeout(request.param("timeout")); 
        
    
  


Goes to:

  
    
      elasticsearch/server/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/action/admin/cluster/stats/ClusterStatsRequest.java
    
    
         Line 31
      in
      41b2b2e
    
    
    
    

        
          
           public class ClusterStatsRequest extends BaseNodesRequest<ClusterStatsRequest> { 
        
    
  


Goes to:

  
    
      elasticsearch/server/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/action/support/nodes/BaseNodesRequest.java
    
    
         Line 91
      in
      41b2b2e
    
    
    
    

        
          
           this.timeout = TimeValue.parseTimeValue(timeout, null, getClass().getSimpleName() + ".timeout"); 
        
    
  


I interpreted this as no default timeout, but it's very possible I'm incorrect.

nodes.bodyText:
The timeout is used when reaching out to all nodes in the cluster, setting a timeout per node. If any of the nodes fail to respond within the timeout, the stats from that node is left out of the response. A failure indication is embedded into the response in the _nodes field.

the request fails and returns an error.

I think this is incorrect or at least imprecise. The request succeeds but includes information about nodes that failed to respond.

nodes.bodyText:
While correct, I think we should define this a bit more loosely to be able to change this without calling it a breaking change. Something like:
Defaults to `1m` (one minute). This guarantees that {es} will wait for at least the timeout before failing, but the actual wait time could be longer (in particular when multiple waits occur).
